title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked, with Zakiya McKenzie on Black in the green movement and why people shouldn't be so polite - The Bristol Cable
description: As a leader of Bristol’s Black and Green project, Zakiya is bringing a background in broadcasting and research to connect the inner city with the...

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with poet Lawrence Hoo, on decolonising education, and if he's now in the establishment - The Bristol Cable
description: As part of the Cable's Black History Month coverage, Neil and Lawrence talk about the renaming of Colston Hall to Bristol Beacon, how education and the arts are key to building positive paths for young people and the role a poet plays in the political process of the city.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Extinction Rebellion activist Chloe Naldrett, on getting arrested and where next for XR - The Bristol Cable
description: Chloe's recent arrest has helped put XR back in the headlines, but how can the movement sustain itself in rebellion against climate catastrophe?

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Paul Smith, the council's housing boss, and how a socialist can be ‘credible’ with developers - The Bristol Cable
description: The famously humorous Hartcliffe local was a city councillor in the 1990s, and then getting re-elected in 2016, bringing professional experience to the role of...

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Desmond Brown, on knife crime, the justice system and being called a ‘police informant’ - The Bristol Cable
description: Desmond has been accused by some of being a police informant, due to his work with local institutions and the police, a claim he strongly refutes as ridiculous.

title: Watch: The struggle for the future of Britain's best street - The Bristol Cable
description: A furore has kicked off over proposals to pedestrianise one of Bristol's most iconic streets, St Marks Road, with famous shop Sweetmart threatening to leave! Easton native Neil Maggs investigates whats going on behind the headlines.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Sam Williamson, head teacher on education in one of the UK's most deprived areas - The Bristol Cable
description: Children's futures almost stolen, inequality made worse by algorithm and education in the time of COVID-19 in some of the UK's most deprived neighbourhoods.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Krazy, the local hip-hop heavyweight who punched a racist - The Bristol Cable
description: As a white man he has been accused of cultural appropriation, despite growing up in the scene.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with David Goldblatt, on how sport can help save us from climate change - The Bristol Cable
description: Football clubs are gonna need gondolas to get supporters to pitches and sports fans are untapped climate change champions, says the leading voice on sport and society.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Jimmy Galvin, the artist who hadn't read a book at 20 - The Bristol Cable
description: Growing up in poverty on north Bristol council estate Lawrence Weston, Jimmy didn’t read a book until he was 20. His life changed when his girlfriend took him to the Tate gallery in London.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Marti Burgess, the first Black Merchant Venturer - The Bristol Cable
description: Marti is the first Black person to join the Merchant Venturers, the 500 year old club of slave trader Edward Colston

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Delroy Hibbert - The Bristol Cable
description: Delroy Hibbert is a Black Lives Matter backer. But he also attended the ‘All Lives Matter’ demonstration in Bristol the week after Colston fell.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Cleo Lake - The Bristol Cable
description: Founding member of Countering Colston, Green party city councillor and former Lord Mayor, Cleo Lake has a lot to say on the big questions of politics, race, history and the future of Bristol and beyond.

title: 'We should have achieved more' - Saunders on love and regret for Rovers
description: The Gas legend discusses the glory days, what went wrong after Gerry Francis, contentious chants and his own disappointing exit

title: 'Career-defining moment' - Rickie Lambert on Rovers, Liverpool, England and more
description: The Bristol Rovers icon discusses his Gas highlights, greatest teammates and his rise from League Two to the World Cup

title: 'I was a non-league player at heart' - Gary Penrice's Bristol Rovers story
description: From Mangotsfield to Aston Villa and QPR in the Premier League, the former Gas striker details his career highlights

title: 'I left with a heavy heart' - Hayles on his Rovers exit, rejecting City and more
description: The Gas legend looks back on his time at the Mem and his rise through the divisions

title: Watch: Resilience - An uplifting story of young mums on one of the UK's oldest council estates - The Bristol Cable
description: A short documentary of young mums overcoming stigma through friendship on one of the UK's oldest council estates, Hillfields in Bristol.
